intro: Teucrium capitatum f. soloitanum, commonly known as the solitary teucrium, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
